text: An Italian gem right in Wrigleyville! We found this restaurant on Yelp and decided to give it a try. We didn't have a try, but the hostess found us a spot at the bar. The staff was so friendly and offered suggestions on what to try. Our meal was delicious, drinks were great, and dessert was even better. I can't wait to come back to this wonderful spot again.

I haven't been to this location in years.  But a pre-concert dinner before Lady Gaga last night at Wrigley Field with my sister was a perfect fit.   The good here never disappoints.  What I will say is I was thrilled that we had a table top for 2 at their outdoor patio as the place is very loud inside. For our appetizer we had the Burrata cheese served with heirloom tomatoes drizzled with balsamic vinegar glaze.  That was delish along with the complimentary bread they bring g to the table.  Tomatoes are so good when in season. For our entree I had the cavatelli with pesto, pine nuts, olive oil & added shrimp.  And my sister had the rigatoni with freshly made Italian sausage and a traditional red sauce.  A generous portion of food for sure.  The only thing disappointing was that I felt our experience was rushed as I specifically asked to not have the food come out immediately after our appetizer.  Needless to say that wasn't the case. Server was friendly, but felt a little pressured to order right away given a concert night.  Otherwise a solid place for a great Italian meal.

Very average.  The restaurant is located in a fun neighborhood near Wrigley Field and that is the best part.  The food was very average.  I had the salmon entree and my daughter had the ribeye.  The ribeye was pan-seared a little too much so the outside had an over-cooked taste to it and the meat wasn't seasoned very much.  My salmon was very strange.  It was completely white on the inside, which made me question the quality of the fish I received.  I have never had a piece of salmon like this before where none of it was salmon-colored!  The taste of the entire salmon dish was just meh.  I think the Francesca chain of restaurants hit their high-point about 15 years ago.  There is much better in Chi-town!

We were guests at a rehearsal dinner on a Friday night. We were up in the second-floor separate dining area which you enter from a set of stairs to the left of the main entrance to the restaurant. They served us lots of different pizzas which were good but in that Neapolitan style which is so popular they were a little too doughy and not crispy enough for my liking. The dinner was sparse. We feel bad for the parents of the groom. The caprese salad for a table of six came out with three tomatoes and three slices of mozzarella. Everyone had to cut a piece in half. Next was the vegetable rigatoni. It came out on a super wide and long plate and basically had one layer of rigatoni and some dry sautéed vegetables. No sauce, no flavor.  Next came a delicious chicken limone with spinach. The spinach was perfectly cooked, not overly done as so many places do but not raw either. It had nice large slices of garlic and a good sauce of butter and lemon. The only problem was that here again it came out with four small chicken breasts (halves) already cut in half so pretty much everyone got only half of a small breast and had to fight for another piece if they wanted more. Best dish of the night was the profiteroles. Crispy choux puff pastry filled with ice cream and a delicious dark chocolate sauce. Not sure if the restaurant portions are like this or if it just happened because it was a party.

Many many years ago, we happened upon this restaurant. It was one of those things that just happen and afterwards you look back and go "wow". We had such a wonderful experience (nearly 10 years ago?) that we've talked about it multiple times since... I always swore that if I ever made it back to Chicago - I'd make a point to visit here again... ...well guess who made it back to Chicago? Yep, you got it! I found this restaurant again, tucked away near "Boys Town"... just a lovely venue. Wanting to re-live my first experience, we asked to be sat on the back patio, which they accommodated. Now, it seems to have changed since my first experience here - but nonetheless - it was wonderful. Their bread is wonderful. Carpaccio - OUT of this world. Dinner - the roasted chicken is one of the best in the country! Wine - (have you ever heard me complain about wine?)!!! Service - fantastic! I can't begin to explain how wonderful it was to have such fond memories of a place and return nearly a decade later and have the memory just simply refreshed to the same level of satisfaction I had the first time! We had such a lovely evening... I hope to return again some day soon!

Tried Mia Francesca on the basis of reviews and a recommendation from a friend.  The room is loud: jarringly, overwhelmingly loud.  The three of us couldn't hear without each of us leaning in and shouting.  The crash of dishes being stacked by the kitchen added to the din.  We were unable to have a real conversation.  It was that loud. The food was average.  Shrimp were overcooked and under-seasoned, gnocchi was very soggy and fragile.  The house salad with hearts of palm and the carpaccio were the standouts for us.  Don't bother with the bread -- it was tough and very salty. The service was also average; nothing special there and had to wait a very long time for our check.  Compared to our other meals in Chicago -- Topolobampo, the Purple Pig, Chez Moi -- it just didn't measure up.   We will just keep looking for a great Italian restaurant.

My husband and I hosted our rehearsal dinner for our wedding here last week and it was absolutely perfect. We used the Coach House in the very back of the restaurant. It has a nice large bar and area for cocktailing (ideal for 10-20) and enough room for one long table for 24. We squeezed 24 in but 15-20 may have been the most comfortable size for this room. We still enjoyed ourselves and it was perfect! The AC kept us nice and cool and we even opened up the doors to the patio to let guests spill out onto the patio as needed. They have VERY reasonably priced packages and spent under $1,700 for everything (including tip). I didn't find that Katherine, their event manager, was especially helpful or made me feel like she was all that attentive to my event, but she was fine. Overall, a great experience! The wait staff and bar staff was incredible, let us play our own music, and the food was great. I highly recommend the Coach House for a similar event!
Great eggs benny and $5 mimosas for Sat brunch. The patio out back had perfect sun and breeze.  There is also a private room and bar just off the patio which looks like a nice venue.
Great food, great wine, great atmosphere. Real charming restaurant with great specials that won't break the bank.
I was deeply impressed by their resotto and krema di peperoni soup! So delicious. Both are vegetarian friendly.

I was really excited to try this place because of all the Yelp reviews. We ordered bruschetta as an appetizer and that was really really good. For a main course I had chicken Alfredo which was pretty plain and unimpressive. For dessert, I had pistachio gelato which was super yummy. The restaurant was super crowded and we were seated next to the kitchen so it was really noisy and cramped.

The service was good. It was a Saturday night so they were quite busy. The only negative thing was that our meals were not hot. They were tepid. They were tasty but would have been better had they been hot.  It wouldn't keep me from coming back though.

We had a reservation for 7:15 pm and showed up early.  They did not have our table ready, but after about a 20 minute wait, they led us to a room in the back.  Nice and quiet, excellent service and excellent food.  The room in the back was nice and quiet.
Highly enjoyed my recent visit to Francesa's.  My entree was delicious but I have to say my favorite part was dessert.  Don't miss out on the chocolate cake with mint ice cream!

Mia Francesca was a pleasant surprise. We ended up splitting three appetizers - the stuffed peppers, burrata, and arancini rice balls - which ended being plenty when accompanied with the warm homemade bread and olive oil with herbs. In addition to that, the service was also great! We will be back for more.
Best Italian meal ever!  Great wine list.  Every dish served to us at our table was outstanding !  Want good Italian food done right, this is a win all around.

The food was excellent- the service not so much. I had to flag down a waiter after sitting down with my parents for 15 minutes . . . Very loud, lots of employees running around but no one was taking care of us.  Not gonna lie - not coming back. Too many options in Chicago where you don't have to ask for a waiter

A delicious dinner and attentive service. Highly recommend the Burrata which was a special but being added to the menu. The heirloom tomatoes were scrumptious. Shrimp special with mushrooms, spinach in white wine was perfect. Son had ravioli which filled the 15 year old (a feat these days). The host Erin was wonderfully attentive as was all staff. The bonus was all Tito's drinks Thursday are $5. Will definitely return here next visit.
Sarah and I just die when we enjoy the fine polenta and the byob Monday's are wonderful when you want to save a buck!

My boyfriend and I stopped in for dinner on a Saturday night.  I was surprised that we were able to get a reservation two hours before we wanted to arrive on a Saturday.  I guess we were lucky.   We were seated upstairs.  It's a little strange that you need to exit the restaurant and use the staircase next door to get to the second floor of the restaurant.  The upstairs was a little more spacious than the first floor, so I was happy that we were seated there. The service was a little spotty.  It took a while for our server to come to our table.  We never received bread (who does not love warm bread with olive oil) and had to ask a hostess who was walking by for it.  When our server did come, he was very distracted, did not look at us and seemed to be in a hurry.   Our food was good.  I ordered the tilapia.  I usually order salmon but my boyfriend chose tilapia for me since he said I needed to order something new.  I'm actually very glad that I did because it was delicious.  It had a really good sauce on it.  He ordered the Penne alla Palermitana and it was very good.  I also ordered a side of roasted veggies and they went perfectly with my fish. The food definitely was great.  I am thinking our server was just having an off day.  It happens.  I'll definitely be back.
Fabulous food and even more fabulous service. I love this place. I don't have a single bad thing to say about Mia Francesca.

The owners of this place and their other locations are great. They go above and beyond for their customers and the food is always fantastic. This is a great week-day dinner spot. I was just there for their throw-back to 1992 prices - what a great promotion! Definitely recommend their pastas and desserts!

Pros: One of the better Italian restaurants food wise (note: I've only tried pasta here). Outstanding service, though may be slow if busy. Awesome patio in the back when the weather is nice. Cons: Can be very crowded on the weekends and the seating is very close, so there's not a lot of privacy for conversations. It can also be very loud. I'd give it a 4/5 for Italian places.

I've been going to Mia Francesca for over 10yrs. While I love the pasta however can't say the same for the seafoods. Do not order anything with shrimp, calamari etc... They are not only frozen but very old. Your stomach will let you know about 30min after.... You're welcome.
Celebrated our anniversary there this week. Fantastic service and food. Really a wonderful night. Appreciated that they have so many wonderful gluten free options as well!

This little joint has a lot of potential, but just missed the bar.  The food was pretty good but the staff could use some improvement.  The appetizers came out quickly and looked and tasted great.  The main course however was a storm of chaos.  The cook staff messed up two of the orders and seemed to think it was the waitresses fault.  Once everyone's food arrived some of the meals were cool to cold and the others were hot.  In addition, the pasta was so al dente somewhere Giada de Laurentiis weeped.  All in all, Mia Francesca is a decent Italian restaurant that just needs to work out the kinks.
Great food and the service is great as well.  Over crowding and lack of any sort of intimacy is the only reason I did not give it a 5th star.

Wow! Just had date night here with the Hubby and we'll be back! Amanda was our server and she was literally the best ever. She was quick to make recommendations about apps, drinks, meal and dessert. When I got my meal and wasn't as in love she was sweet and let me exchange it. Plus the bread and oil was to die for and the molten cake was THE BEST!  thanks Amanda- you're the reason we'd be back.

Wow! I am absolutely in love with this Italian restaurant. I had walked by it a million times and so glad I finally went in. The calamari is A MUST! It's very fresh and perfectly lightly breaded with a i-can-just-drink-it-down marinara style sauce. Most restaurants offer calamari and this is on my top 5. And I am not sure if there is any dressing in the caprese salad but it's perfect the way it is. The tomato is fresh, sweet and juicy. It's thickly sliced topped with creamy mozzarella. For entrees, I always always go for the seafood spaghetti and I hate myself for not trying something else but it's that good. It's fresh seafood mixed with al dente spaghetti swimming in a light but rich in flavor sauce with a little heat. I can't wait to come back on Wed for the lasagna special. And shoutout to Erin for your impeccable friendly service. You make the restaurant feel like home.

We were worried with our two under three that it wouldn't be very kid friendly but it was. They were very accommodating. The food was great and it came in perfect portions. After dinner we couldn't pass up the Gelato...delicious. I will definitely go back the next time I'm back in Chicago.

My meal was cooked to perfection and that was even without butter!!! I ordered the White fish w/scallops, capers, spinach, n peppers and it was delicious!! I have dietary restrictions and I expected the typical lightly seasoned, lightly flavored dish that would fit into my restrictions.....I was extremely surprised. Tons of flavor!!! Would return here in a heart beat. The wine was amazing as well. I order a couple of glasses of the Allegrini Veronese.
Just good Italian food. For us, just to noisy and tables to crammed together. Nothing special or outstanding.

The food was very good but the noise level was LOUD. Seriously LOUD. I brought out of town guests and we could barely hear each other. The tables were packed together, people were bumping into our chairs as they would move between the tables. We had reservations at 6:30 on a Sat. night, maybe that was why. In any case, I am a big fan of Francesca restaurants (I've been to the ones on Taylor in Little Italy, Chestnut St, and Madison in Forest Park) so I expected a similar dining experience. I will go to the other restaurants, I won't come to this one again.

Favorite date spot. Loud inside so try to sit outside or in the back bar. They change their menu often which is why it is so great for dates. Amazing service and the best olive oil.. guaranteed to eat a whole loaf of bread with the olive oil+pasta sauce

This place has gone down hill. Prices up. Quality down. I added a photo of how they packed two half pizzas that were leftover. Seriously? Ever heard of a pizza box?  Or at least not piling it up like dog food. They have earned their last dollar from me.

We were in Chicago for 4 days, and we had lunch here twice. That is how great this place is. Its quaint, cute and seems like a well kept secret.  We tried the house special half chicken, and  pretty much every pasta on the menu.  Kudos to you folks for showing a couple folks from Arizona a great time. We'll be back.

Friends were visiting from Michigan and wanted to try this place, so we went along.  It was very average.  We were able to sit on the patio, which was lovely.  That was probably a highlight of the night, along with the cucumber berry drink I ordered.  Yum! The menu is just okay.  I was little disappointed a the pasta options.  There weren't a ton to choose from and most were in a tomato sauce of sorts.  I recognize that I am very much in the minority on this, but I don't like red sauce.  As such, my options were limited.  If you like pomodoro or marinara, you're probably all clear.  I ended up going with the rigatoni in a tomato cream sauce.  It was pretty good.  The sausage was flavorful.  But it wasn't something that stood out among the many other Italian places in the city.  I was also a little disappointed that it didn't come with a side salad or anything.  As others mentioned, the crusty bread was good.  But a salad would have helped.  I ended up ordering a caesar salad, and the lettuce was limp and yellowed.  It was edible, but not worth $7. The service was just okay.  To be fair, they were very accommodating to let us chat (and close the restaurant! Our reservation was at 7 and we were chatting until 10 not knowing they closed at 9).  We had paid our bill and were checked out so that they could close up.  We didn't realize that we kept them open an hour after the restaurant technically closed because we were secluded on the back patio.  We felt bad about it as we were leaving, but they were nice to us on that front.  In other news, our server was okay.  She checked on us once and followed up when she overheard a member of our party didn't like his drink.  The drinks were slow to arrive and we waited a while to order.  But it worked out fine as we were catching up with old friends.   All in all, I doubt I'll return.  Why choose mediocre Italian when you can get GREAT Italian at other places in our fine city?

If you want to experience the vibrancy and energy of Wrigleyville in a restaurant (as opposed to a bar), I would guess this would be the prototypical place.  We had a Saturday night outing here and it was packed and energetic.  I found the food to be very good based on the appetizers and gnocchi ala bolognese dinner entree ($18) I had.  Appetizers were bruschetta and a proscuitto wrapped cantaloupe dish.   It was quite loud and somewhat difficult to carry on a conversation.  The tables are also packed quite tightly and there is really no elbow room.  For that as aspect as well as the overbearing loudness, I would go for a 4 star rating here for our outing.  Prices are reasonable here for the quality and portion size, so this could be a 5 star sort of business except for what I mentioned.  They also change the menu frequently I am told, and everyone in our party of 7 enjoyed their entrees.  They have an open kitchen format, so avoid a table by the server traffic if at all possible. They also have $10 valet and that was very handy given, unbeknownst to us, that there was a Pearl Jam concert at nearby Wrigley Field, so really impossible to get street parking around here on this night anyway.
Their bread and oil is great, the oil is herb infused and a delight for the palate Pastas are wonderfully diverse, and very filling The place is a little cramped at popular times

Came here a week ago with a large group for dinner and it was all together a great experience. Our meals were delicious and served in a good amount of time and the service was exceptional. Will definitely be returning when I'm in need of a nice place to take people.

Had a nice dinner here with my girl the other night.  I had the gnocchi with meat sauce, it was awesome!  It inspired me to make batch of my homemade meat sauce, so yummy.  I also had there Caesar salad, with their homemade classic dressing.   My girl had the seafood pasta with a traditional slightly spicy red sauce.  This dish was also very good, and was highly recommended by our waitress.   In addition, we had a couple glasses of wine through our meal, which were solid choices.  My issue here is that I think their wine list is overpriced.  In the future I will be more careful about what I order in the beverage department.   All and all it is a solid place for good ITALIAN affair!

Oh my goodness. Nothing but positive comments. Awesome waitstaff, awesome gluten free pasta, awesome choices of wines. Went on date night and had a reservation. Probably could have done without but it was nice to know we had a place. Wish we had known there was a patio to sit on though! Would have loved to be outside. All around delicious! Only recommendation would be to have a GF bread option as an appetizer when there is regular bread-but it did help me save a couple calories I guess!

Food was mediocre and service was horrible. Wasnt even a busy night.  I waited 45 minutes for my appetizer which they messed up then another 20 minutes for them to fix it then another 20 minutes for my entree. I was never so hungry in my entire friggin life.  Won't be returning here

Been here plenty of times to find out they had a 2nd floor, nice, as it was not as crazy busy as the 1st one. The pork special with mushrooms and pasta on the side was amazing. I usually order a salad or/and appetizer, and I can see I have missed out on some really good food:)

I have been a fan of this place for some time.  It's not the best Italian food in the city, but it's pretty good and it has been consistent.  Until yesterday, that is.   For some time, I have been a fan of going with the missus and getting a couple sides/salads and a pizza (the Quattro Stagioni, with prosciutto, artichokes, arugula, mushrooms and an egg in the middle, the runny yolk of which gets spread over the pizza).  Yesterday we decided to go for a late lunch.  We got there about 1, there were 4 other table seated, and they were clearly in wind-down mode from the main lunch rush.  We proceeded to have one of the poorer dining experience in recent memory.  It took forever for our drinks to come out.  The asparagus/tomato/blue cheese salad was drowning in dressing.  We were offered bread (which we accepted), then it wasn't brought until we asked several minutes later.  And the pizza, very sadly, was a disaster.  There were ingredients on it that didn't belong (per the menu and the 7-8 times I've had it previously).  It was greasy and heavy.  And the egg was almost completely uncooked, which I didn't realize until it was being spooned over the pizza.  I had to tell him to stop because it was going to render the pizza inedible.  The egg is supposed to be partially cooked, and the heat of the pizza takes care of the rest.  Problem is, the pizza was no longer hot.  It appears the pizza had been taken out, sat for a couple/few minutes and cooled, then the egg was put on, and it was a gloppy, slimy mess.   When the server came by to take our plates, I told him we were done and would like the check,  7-8 minutes later, no check.  He finally came by and offered us dessert menus.  "No thank you, just the check please."  Another 7-8 minutes before the check came.  Keep in mind, we were one of 5 seated tables in the whole place.   I would have given this place 3.5-4 stars previously, and I don't want to ding them too bad for one unpleasant experience, but it was a thoroughly bad experience almost from top to bottom.
Brunch was delicious and very Italian in nature. Had fried polenta with Italian sausage and an authentic tomato sauce, two perfectly poached eggs too.

The salmon was the best I have had in a long time. Nice presentation. Crisp grilled asparagus. Delicious avocado pieces. Thursday they offer Makers Mark for $5 ! Service was friendly and prompt. Paper table cloth is cheap solution to cost control. It doesn't add to the ambiance. However, the noise level was terrible. The tables are so tightly packed they had trouble serving as they couldn't get between them.  This would be a higher rated review but for the noise and crowded seating. It definitely detracts from the dining experience enough to reconsider my choice next time.

Best part was the bread. Very disappointed with yet another restaurant location from them. Service was extra slow and very unpleasant, especially the host. The salmon came with no presentation or flavor. The fish tasted salty and frozen. The calamari on top was rubbery. The price to quality ration just doesn't add up for me. The bill for 3 people was $180, and we were very dissatisfied. The drinks were ok, nothing special, I'd go with the wine if needed.

Fabulous service paired with spectacular food equals neighborhood gem! My family has only done take-out, but as sweet and helpful as Joe is over the phone, we might just keep it that way! I can feel his smile every time I call. We have eaten several of the pastas and pizzas and have always been satisfied with how well the food was prepared and packaged for enjoyment. Italian can be hit or miss when it comes to take-out. I assure you take-out from Mia Francesca's restaurant is a HIT!

Awful place.  Food is way overpriced for what it is.  Servers barely speak English and are rude.  Busboys are always saying rude things in Spanish and are always snickering at girls who walk by.  Food is bland and doused in oils and cheap ingredients.  Nothing is fresh here.  Save your money!!!!

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago for many years.  Everyone I've taken her loves it and wants to go back.  The food is fantastic, the atmosphere fun and energetic.  Great service.   Can't go wrong.

I met up with a few of my friends for dinner here. The staff was very nice and friendly. We didn't have to wait for the whole party to be there to be seated, which is a nice change from most restaurants in the city. The bread they bring out with the olive oil is okay. I've had better but the olive oil is infused with other herbs and seasoning and is really good. Appetizers were excellent, I had the bruschetta plate and the orzo platter. Their entrees were good but nothing spectacular. It's a great spot for a causal lunch or dinner with family and friends
Gosh I wanted to live this place as it was highly recommended by several of our friends but it was mediocre. The food was pretty good. Not fantastic. Service and bar drinks were slow!

We went on a Saturday. There were three of us. They said they were busier than normal, but with that in mind, here's my take.  Service: 3 Stars! :(  The servers were all very nice, but the service was SO slow! We stood at the door and waited just to be acknowledged. It took TWO HOURS, from start to finish, to eat and pay. We asked for bread two times. It took a long time to get our drinks. It took a long time to get anything. I was ready to leave without dessert because it took about as long as our meal, maybe longer. I would give this place four stars if the service and wait times weren't so horrible. :(  Food: Some 2-3 and some 4-5 Stars.  The food ranged from really tasty to mediocre at best. I will add pictures of our dishes.  Don't Order: Calamari Fritti! Blah! Tasteless. Bland. Sub par. Avoid! Don't Order: Pizzas. They are just blah. Nothing worth writing home to mom about.  DO Order:  Burrata Pomodorini! A great appetizer! I actually didn't want to share mine. It's like an mouthgasm explosion of a mound of several cheeses. I went back the next day for more.  DO Order: Italian sausage and mushroom dish. It was my favorite!!!! OK to Order:  The chicken over spinach. It's adequately good, but not amazing. It's tasty.  Drinks: The Smashing Peaches was a tasty sweet adult beverage. ;) They also have a special on Saturdays for a $20 mimosa that was quite yummy. We had a flavored one.
I found the staff extremely friendly, the atmosphere typical of a restaurant in Italy and the food excellent.

It has become a tradition in my family to take my parents to Mia Francesca when they come into town. We have been 5 or 6 times in the last few years and we always enjoy ourselves. The service is always super personable, friendly, and knowledgable. My mom has some recent food restrictions and our server was really great about explaining things and accommodating my moms questions and concerns. The food here is always wonderful! Traditional Italian but never boring. This most recent time, we had: buratta appetizer (A+++), salmon, cheese ravioli, shrimp pasta, and cavatelli bolognese. I was also very impressed with their specials this time around. We tried the white and red wines on special, as well as one of the apps and one of the entrees. We were very impressed all around!  Probably my only complaint is that this is a loud, small dining room. Tables are close together and you get to know your neighbors pretty well. Not necessarily a bad thing, just so that you are aware going in- no candlelit romantic dining here!

Went here with a friend, and I was pretty impressed, The pasta was great, the waiter was really friendly, and the old fashioned I ordered was perfect. It is a little pricey, but it is definitely worth it. This place is always really packed, so it would be a good idea to get a reservation.

I came with some friends for a nice dinner out. We walked in and were immediately acknowledged by the hostess and what I assumed was the manager of the restaurant.  Once we were seated we were promptly given drinks and menus. The waiters were so attentive and friendly. The excellent service continued all through the evening which only enhanced our experience. As for the delicious food, we had no complaints. I had the salmon which was perfectly soft and drenched in a mushroom cream sauce. I devoured the whole thing. My sisters and friends also enjoyed their meals and we ended up tasting each other's food to see who had the best dish. Every dish held its own. We had the chicken alla Romana, the salmon, spaghetti with scallops, and the gnocchi. It was the perfect evening ambience for wine, conversation, laughs, and good food. The cherry on top was the dessert with a little limoncello. We enjoyed it thoroughly and it made our evening that much more memorable. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for their food, ambience, and service! We will be back!

I don't have any complaints about this place.  The food was good--not great.  Service was prompt.  Price was a bit high for the quality of the food, but it's Chicago.  Atmosphere was mostly casual, but I could see bringing a date here.  Families with small children were seated near by.  Overall we were satisfied and would probably come back here after carefully considering lower priced options in the area.

I really enjoy this place. The food has always seemed fresh and the dishes well-executed. The specials are also good so I would suggest taking a look at those. The service is prompt and friendly - my friend asked if he could order something they used to have on the menu  and the waiter and the chef found a way to put the dish together (very well I might add). A consistently good experience.

I didn't think there was enough variety on the menu or enough simple options for people who don't like overly complicated food. I think it is over priced as well. I paid $18 for chicken alfredo and I wasn't impressed with the quality of the meat. The one thing I did love was their seasonal pumpkin bread pudding.  That was delicious!  Overall it was ok but too expensive and not worth it for me to come back.
Dude. Food is legit. Take your main gash there, and get something with white sauce. It's white girl approved.
went here day before Valentines and had a opentable reservation. So glad we did as the place was packed. Sound levels were high, but food and service was amazing.  Valentine special menu was awesome

This was one of the restaurants I could find on open table for a last minute dinner reservation. The food was average. The other folks in our group actually liked the food but said they wouldn't specifically seek out this place again. My husband's salmon was pretty well cooked but there was a mix-up with the order so he got his food late. They took that off the check to compensate but that wasn't exactly seamless either. We were super confused by it. Eventually they took care of it. I don't think my rating was heavily influenced by that incident. I wasn't really blown away by anything here.. It was overall just OK in pretty much every aspect. Not sure I'd recommend it to anyone looking to have a great Italian dinner in chi-town either.

My wife and I were excited to dine at Mia Francesca this past Friday, but it turned out being a really crappy experience. We were seated in their "annex" which is an upstairs area directly adjacent to the main restaurant. I'm thinking that they are still learning how to manage that portion of the restaurant, but it was as if we were dining at a completely different restaurant. A few highlights from the evening: * The waiter had no idea if their Restaurant Week prixe fixe menu was still going on. Turns out it was, so he brought those menus by about 10 minutes after we were seated. * Mid appetizer, we hear a man at a table next to us exclaim "YOU SERVED MY KID RAW CHICKEN." Yikes! They left promptly after that. * The time in between courses was painfully slow. Luckily, my wife and I had no other plans that night and were happy to sit and drink our wine together. However, if we had other plans, it would've been a big problem. * After our main entrees, we waited about 25 minutes and the waiter finally brought us our check. Buuut we were hoping to order some dessert, so we asked for a piece of Tiramisu. * After dessert, we waited for the check for 30 minutes. During those 30 minutes, two separate runners tried to serve additional dessert plates that were supposed to go to a different table. * During the wait, we noticed every other table was waiting for something. It became comical because of how bad it was. * The ordeal lasted 3+ hours. We won't be returning to Mia Francesca for quite a while.

Checked out this location today during Chicago Restaurant Week. Nice menu choices, as would be expected of any of the FRG spots.  The offerings comprised an app, pasta, main and dessert. The linguini with shrimp and asparagus was spot-on, and a pork chop with peppers and mushrooms was very tasty while a bit overcooked. The star was a mini lemon bundt with lemon glaze and whipped cream.  The staff were as nice as could be, and it's an all-around great standby.

We usually dine at Francesca's North in Northbrook but, since my son lives in Wrigleyville and we were celebrating my Birthday we ventured to the location on Clark Street. Parking was easy for us, cause we have the #383 parking permit which is required in this neighborhood. However, Mia does offer valet service for reasonable $. This location is super narrow and doesn't accommodate many tables, so make a reservation.  We got to Mia before it became really crowded and our waiter was not as prompt as we would have liked. When you have to encourage the waiter to take your order, it's disappointing.  For a starter, we ordered the Bruschette con Coppa, which came to us over flowing with tomatoes. Very good.  We dine at Francesca's often cause we know the food is going to be consistently good Italian cuisine, this time it was just "ok". The kitchen staff seemed to be non-enthusiastic that night. In my Open Table reservation I noted that I was celebrating my birthday and was given a complimentary dessert complete with a lite candle, which was appreciated.  Note: Upon our arrival I had to use the women's restroom. The person who had just occupied the bathroom stated there was no toilet paper, ugh! I tried to find a waiter to re-stock and OMG! That was interesting, no one seemed to know where the TP was located. Finally someone went downstairs. It took awhile, my family thought I had left. Question: prior to the dinner hour, shouldn't this be on their list to research the bathrooms and see if they need cleaning or re-stocking?

I made reservations here on a Saturday night for a group of 4 of us.  I would highly recommend reservations on a weekend anyway, because it was very busy in there.  The tables are sat pretty close together, but it's not uncomfortably close. Our server was friendly and nice, but took her a few minutes to come to our table when we sat down.  But when we asked her for recommendations she was very helpful.  The portions are pretty big here, but nothing super special about any of the food we got here. We ordered fried calamari to start.  Our group ordered 2 Linguine al Sugo di Gamberi (seafood linguine), Vitello alla Disperata (veal), and Pizza della Foresta (mushroom pizza).  I enjoyed the pizza the most.

Upscale yet welcoming atmosphere. Accommodating and attentive staff. Perfect pasta and fresh seafood (get the calamari). Unexpectedly child-friendly, which added to the warmth of this neighborhood standard.

I always enjoyed Mia Francesca when I lived in Wrigleyville.  It wasn't too far up the street, and they always changed the menu.  Every time I went I had something different, and I always enjoyed it.  I took a few dates here, and they equally loved it.  The staff was always friendly and knowledgeable. The wine selection was solid, and I just never had any complaints.  Overall, Mia Francesca is a great Chicago Italian restaurant.

So delicious! I ordered delivery from here one night (I was trying the new Caviar app, and feeling Italian). I ordered the Dei Sardi (rigatoni with sausage and mushrooms), the mixed vegetables, and asparagus. SERVICE: The food came so quickly - I was quoted an hour, and it came within 40 min easily! Not only that, but they included a huge chunk of fresh Italian bread (still warm!!) with olive oil and Parmesan. What great service.  FOOD: the food itself was delicious. The sausage was so flavorful, and they were very generous with the portions. The bread was amazing; even after being delivered, it was still warm and crusty. The olive oil they provided with the bread even had bits of basil in it. I would have preferred if the vegetables were a little fresher. I understand that they had to travel a little farther than had I eaten it, but the asparagus and mixed veggies alike were both drenched in sauce. The asparagus had a creamy garlicky sauce (delicious, but heavy), and the mixed vegetables were swimming in oil. When I order veggies I prefer them to balance out the carb-heavy pasta and bread, not add to it!  Overall, a great place. I live a little far to justify going frequently, but definitely a solid choice for Italian if you live nearby or are in the area.

We've been here a few times hoping that the food served was an anomaly...its just beneath average unfortunately.  Gave them a fair shot...about 10yrs ago it was a good place to dine, but the quality of food has suffered drastically since then.  We've had some bad service issues, poor delivery issue...and the food isn't worth those problems. Note:  do not order gluten free pasta dishes as the noodles (which are typically rice based) are just falling apart...that will kill your entree. Train your bar staff to be attentive- not just friendly...when my wine glass is empty, ask if I might want a refill.  I might even like a glass of water with my meal...!

Great food!  But 2nd time I ordered a gluten free pizza and the WRONG pizza was delivered to me. Will never order pizza from this place again. I will go to the restaurant but no more takeout. How hard is it to get a pizza right?

We've been making the rounds to all of the neighborhood places we'd miss after the move. This restaurant pretty much ranks up there in my list of top ten Lakeview eats. Good food, good service, easy-going neighborhood buzz. The kids menu is such value too -- $6 for a main, a drink, and a gelato! Word of advice: try to get a seat in the outdoor patio if you can. They don't take reservations for that section but dinner alfresco during the warmer months is a much better experience than in the main dining room, which can feel a little claustrophobic due to the tight table spacing and crowds.

As always, the Mia Francesca chain does not disappoint.  It is a suburban place so it does close early by downtown standards.  The broiled half chicken was excellent, although a sauce was just a tad salty.  No worries, it went well with Chianti by the glass.  Most entrees are large enough to split, and the valet parking is free.

This was my first time dining at the restaurant. The wait staff was great and the food was amazing.  I had the Apollo con Spinaci. Chicken with spinach and it was cooked perfectly. The location is great too . We went prior to a cubs game.
Great place for brunch. Friendly staff and waiters and the food was fantastic. Do try out their mimosas and bloody mary (awesome...)

Service outstanding with Fernando making excellent recommendations. Prices very reasonable at $15-20 per entree with huge portions. Quality of food was excellent - had the carpaccio for appetizer and large riggotoni with slow cooked pot roast for entree.  Atmosphere was great. Highly recommend to anyone in the mood for rustic Italian in a great Lincoln Park setting on Clark St.

oh yea...i really liked this place....I blew in from the west coast and have an Italian uncle from Brooklyn as my background so I know good Italian. My unc can cook! Carpaccio Con Arugola, Asparagus, Blue Cheese, Tomato, salad, salmon, chicken picatta and Parmesan were great! Had another salad w/ great dressing  Cernia con Asparagi - Pan-roasted red grouper with wild mushrooms, asparagus, sun-dried tomatoes, white wine, garlic, lemon and balsamico is incredible. I used to live in FL...I know grouper...and this grouper deserved a diamond ring! If i lived in Chi town I'd be here ...like....all da time!

I took my parents here for a celebratory dinner. The food and atmosphere lived up to the occasion. It was very busy but our waitress was still very attentive to us.  The portions were large and delicious. Some times you go to places where you think they give you a lot of food but it's cheap, poor quality. Not at Mia Francesca. On the contrary, everything tasted fresh and homemade. I'll definitely go back.

Still the best of the Francesca chain in my opinion. We were a party of 4 last night and the food and service was perfect! Never thought you could combine avocado and chopped tomatoes over Salmon, but it was one of the best combos I have ever had. I'm still amazed how they serve so many people so quickly - they are ALWAYS packed and it works. Been coming here since they opened and have NEVER had a bad meal!

Somewhat limited menu but very reasonably priced and in a great location.  Mixed group of people dining...from families in very casual attire to couples celebrating something.  Overall a good experience.
The Clark location continues to deliver a 5 star experience in all fronts: professionalism of the staff, food quality,, etc...a solid and consistent neighborhood classic not to be missed!

Have been coming to francescas for years and have been to nearly every location.   By far the best service,  personality  and hospitality is done by Fernando and Terry at this location.   They really make you feel like you are at home.   If I could give 6 stars I would.

I was here for my birthday dinner. I was impressed by the nice and courteous behavior of the host and wait staff. Have I had better Italian food elsewhere? Yes of course, but their service was award winning! The bread was served warm fresh from the oven-so delicious. The bruschetta and Neapolitans pizza were great too. The lentil appetizer was a-ok. The eggplant rigatoni, spinach ravioli were fantastic too. The pesto cavatelli lacked some flavor. Wine list was superb. My friends had the mussels and the chicken+shrimp entree and they loved it. They dimmed the lights for the cake cutting creating a beautiful atmosphere Ruth the candle lit cake. Overall had a fantastic experience!

My wife and I have gone to Mia Francescas since the night we got engaged. Every year since (5) we have returned on our anniversary and the experience is great every time. The food is outstanding and so is the service. The staff is very welcoming and treated us to complimentary champagne and desert for our special occasion...you can't beat that!  Another great quality I enjoy about Mia Francescas is the perfect amount of service. This is a personal quality I enjoy, and my opinion may vary from others, but I'm going to put it out there anyway. The service is much like it is in Europe, the waiter/waitress comes by very little, and I LOVE that. I cannot stand it when a server comes over 12 times during my dinner and interrupts a conversation, reaches in front of me while I'm still eating my salad, or filling up my water so many times that the table looks like the mens room floor. Our waiter was perfect in his timing and the staff cleared our table at the appropriate times. Some people like it when the waiter is coming by every minute...not me, so I appreciate the way Mia Francesca operates.  As always, my wife and I will continue to dine at Mia Francesca every anniversary, and even date nights.

Good service, good food. Ordered a pesto dish and a rigatoni broccoli and cream sauce dish. Portions were slightly smaller than expected for America but still acceptable. Vibes were a little crowded but still not too overbearing. Would return, though slightly out of my personal price range.
Food and ambiance was great! We had the dessert special - Limoncello Tiramisu - it was heavenly!

I used to love this restaurant.  I haven't been here in years...like 7-8 years.  But it wasn't how I remembered it. Definitely still bustling.  It's loud.  It's crowded.  It's crammed. Service was really meh.  Server wasn't engaging & didn't really offer up much for suggestions when asked. The food wasn't how I remembered either.  It tasted like a step above OG or Magiannos.  Very plain, very cookie cutter, very meh. Overall, there are about a million other Italian places I would rather spend my $$ on.  It's really just ok.  I probably won't go back.

Went here for a surprise bday party and the food and service were fantastic! We had the carriage house in the back and it was great!  Had spinach cheese pizza, gnocchi, and s chicken potato dish and the main meals were great! For dessert We had cheesecake and these chocolate gelato puffs that were too die for!!! Highly recommend this place!!

I've dined at other Francesca's restaurants and have always had a great experience.  This time not so much.  First off always ask for a table in the front.  We were in the back separate area and it wasn't great.  I ordered a Black Label and was told they don't offer that brand of Scotch.  No biggy, but what they had was awful.  I thought they had a full bar.  The food was just OK.  I had a chicken pasta dish and the chicken was dry and bland.  My friend had an eggplant pasta dish and it was just OK.  The service was good but I probably would choose a different Francesca restaurant next time.

"May I re-chill your cosmo?" With these words, Mia Francesca on Clark has become my favorite restaurant. In my many years of ordering and consuming cosmos, in restaurants around the United States (and London and Montreal and on international waters and island ports of call), I have never experienced this level of outstanding customer service. In fact, this statement has reached a new, previously unknown level of favored phrase status. Prior to this, my favorite word combination was "Dinner is served." Today, a new combination of letters, spaces, and punctuation has become my new favorite, and it's very difficult to imagine anything overtaking it-- except perhaps "Your private jet is waiting." Terry approached our table, while my martini glass was still 3/4ths full, and somehow anticipated that my drink might no longer be at the ideal temperature. If you love martinis, you know what the ideal temperature is-- it's that condition where there is a thin layer, almost just a hint; of ice at the top of the drink-- allowing the contents to be beautifully, perfectly chilled. The glass itself, of course, also must be chilled-- frosted, actually. Unfortunately, this condition only lasts for a few moments. Perhaps ten, if you're lucky. It had been ten minutes. The frost had disappeared, there was no more layer of thin ice at the top of the drink. Terry identified this tragedy and corrected it immediately with his magic words. A few minutes later, my drink re-appeared, with the glass freshly frosted, and the temperature again perfect. May you re-chill my cosmo? Yes. Will I be back? Yes. Thank you Terry.

No italian food at all. ..im from italy and I really know my country food sorry but this plaste made my italy s...start with fried calamari Brown crost mean dirty oil.carpaccio no seasoned at all. .meatballs pasta the sauce was bland and meatballs test like older or maybe frozen....please call this food with another name but never call it italian cousine. ..
I walked in with my boyfriend and we were seated right away even though the restaurant was busy. I was very pleased with the good food and attentive staff! A nice place for romantic dinner!

Before you read on, I feel I should say that this is the third time I've dined here, and the first two times were great....tonight, not so much.  We live in the neighborhood and felt like italian last minute, so hopped on open table and Mia Francesca was wide-open for reservations.  When we walked in to check in, the place was packed, lively and bustling as we expected.  Assuming we would be seated at one of the few open tables, they quickly informed us we would be seated upstairs, where we had to go outside and through another door.  Turns out, the "upstairs dining room" is really their overflow dining room, which was a few small two tops surrounded by a long table seating a giant party in which the majority of people were under the age of 10.  As we sat there deciding on what wine/apps to order we had 3 or 4 kindergartners with sugar highs sprinting laps around our table and running back and forth along the banister that we were sitting against. The parents were oblivious and the staff didn't seem to care either.  The upstairs dining room was literally the kids table.     The food was good, but the atmosphere ruined it.  Not something I would have expected from an 8:30 reservation on a saturday night at Mia Francesca.  It was like being at TGI Friday's with Mia Francesca's food.  Maybe they should let you know when reserving that you'll be in the overflow room to avoid this issue!!

Really enjoyed the restaurant week dinner menu - too much food!  The bruschetta and the chicken were amazing.   We also really liked sitting upstairs - quieter than the main dining room. Would def go back.

I rarely write Yelp reviews as I feel I should only do so to add something valuable to anyone reading them. In this case (and I apologize for the ALL CAPS), I think this problem needs to be noted: THIS PLACE DOES NOT HONOR THEIR RESERVATIONS!! If you're like most people, you probably have the silly belief that making a reservation at a restaurant serves to ensure that you have a table at (or very near) the requested time. As someone who gets irked by even a five minute wait for a reserved table, the fact I waited nearly an hour for my table only speaks to the mendacity of both the hostesses and the manager who kept insisting that a table would free up "in a manner of minutes". This obvious lie was repeated so many times that I began to feel  as if I was being unreasonable by checking on my reservation - even though it was clear from the dining room that no one was leaving soon given no checks were visible on any table. It became rather clear that "reservation" to Mia's was simply a way to reserve your space in the "wait queue".   When we were finally seated after 9pm (for an 8:15pm) reservation, there was nary a word of apology from either the hostess or waiter. The manager eventually stopped by and apologized for the wait and offered a free appetizer to both my friend and I.  My friend did not want an appetizer and the manager obnoxiously pointed out that he would only comp an appetizer and nothing else, clearly stressing this was all that would be offered. Given we hadn't even asked for a comp, it was infuriating to have him set limitations on something that wasn't wanted or needed. What we really wanted was an hour of our lives back but it was obvious that the manager didn't seem to care about the fact he had wasted our time and screwed up our plans for the night. I quickly ordered a soup because I felt we should get *something* . Rather predictably, the $6 soup appeared to totally absolve the manager of having to care about the situation any further. He never checked in again -- and so was blissfully unaware that the lobster bisque soup that was eventually served was partially cold and didn't have any lobster! It was just a bowl of heavy cream with tomato sauce. Given how hungry we were at this point, we choked it down.  To add insult to injury, I then had to suit up to go outside and walk 4 blocks in sub-zero weather to add extra time to the meter since it had run out. I stupidly only put an hour in the meter thinking we couldn't possibly be staying for that much longer.   Our food did not come for another forty-five minutes. When it arrived, my hungry friend and I started shoving it in our mouths only to stop dead at the taste. The sauce of the salmon had a strange acidic flavor that made the dish taste weird and wrong.  Despite being ravenous, we both frustratingly switched back to the bread and tried to spot the waiter to send it back. He was nowhere to be found, so we were stuck eating bread. When he finally reappeared much later it was only to ask if we wanted to take the dish home, taking no note of the fact barely anything was eaten. When I emphatically stated No!, he simply whisked the dish away with no comment.  We declined dessert as we just wanted to leave at this point since the meter had run out and we had just spent our entire night waiting around to eat cold soup and bread. But once again, we were kept waiting for the check to get picked up. It was now going on 11pm. I'm usually a person that doesn't complain (as I find voting with my feet to be effective), but I was so angry at this point that I had actually decided to make a comment to the staff before I left about how horrible the whole experience had been - and how our plans for the night were ruined. Of course, I was denied even this small consolation as there was no one around to complain to. The hostesses had both disappeared and the manager was nowhere to be found. We left without fanfare after almost three hours of being treated with something akin to contempt and getting an expensive bill shoved under our noses at the end of it. The lack of even a Thank You from anyone in the restaurant as we left seemed to say it all about how they feel about their customers. While Mia's will probably always be busy - their location allows them to recycle through customers relatively easily - it's clear this is not due to good food or service. I will end my post the way I begin since this essentially encapsulates how they feel about their customers and it's rather useful information to anyone trying to plan their night: THEY DO NOT HONOR THEIR RESERVATIONS. And the food and service is just inexcusable on top of that.

First off, this is coming from a former employee of Mia Francesca's.  SCOTT HARRIS IS A COMPLETE FRAUD AND LIAR.  This guy gets away with paying his busboys $2.50 an hour and makes his staff tip out in cash the difference to make up for the minimum wage he does not pay them.  Also, if you work for this company, be expected as a server to dole out 50% of YOUR tips to foodrunners, busboys, and the bartender.  It's a total SCAM, and I am highly shocked that the IRS has not got a hold of Scott Harris' nuts by now.  See, the devil is in the details.  Every night, as a server, you have to claim all of your credit card tips.  But, you tip everyone out in cash tips.  When your taxes come at the beginning of the year, you will owe a shit ton of money, close to double what you ACTUALLY earned.  My tax return said I made $40,000, I actually made about $28,000, all clear, and I owed the government.  This company is a complete disgrace, and highly illegal.

My first visit to Mia Francesca was on New Year's Eve, 2014.  We sat next to a very loud table of 12.  It was nearly impossible to get our waiter's attention.  I checked my phone and he didn't come around to get our entree orders for 50 minutes.  Five-oh.  Fifty.  Minutes. Granted, the place was packed for New Year's, but that table told us they pre-booked a package.  We, too, had made reservations, so it's not like they didn't know they'd be busy.  You'd think a manager would swoop in when they saw us waving at the oblivious waiter.  It seemed like a total breakdown of operations. I'm trying to take that with a grain of salt.  Too often on Yelp, people blast a restaurant for circumstances out of its control.  Yes, they should have been more heavily staffed.  Or they could have apologized.  Or comped a glass of wine.  But they didn't.  And that put an unfortunate bad taste in my mouth. Now, to the food... * Prosciutto con Burrata - prosciutto di parma with creamy burrata cheese, basil-pine nut pesto, balsamic glaze and extra virgin olive oil.  I loved this.  The prosciutto was great.  I used it to roll up some burrata bites.  Most excellent. * Pollo Arrosto alla Romano ($17) - Roasted half chicken with garlic, shallots, rosemary, lemon and olive oil, served with roasted potatoes.  Quite good.  An enormous serving for $17.  The chicken sits in a pool of delicious gravy-type goodness.  I couldn't eat much of this because I went to town on the complimentary bread while waiting a minor eternity to get our entrees. I believe Mia Francesca could be an awesome place on a quieter night.  I may revisit it in the future.

I've been going to this establishment for years.  It is consistently some of the best Italian food on the north side.  Like any good Italian eatery it's louder and tight quarters but I will be back often.
Excellent food, great atmosphere. Really enjoyed and will definitely go back next time I'm in the city!!
I thought the quality of food was very good. Calamari could've been a little more cooked, but overall not disappointed. Service was very attentive and prompt. I'd definitely go back.

The service was great, the atmosphere was intimate (but not too romantic for a sister date), the food was phenomenal, and the portions weren't insanely large like some Italian places. They were enough to make you just slightly uncomfortably full if you ate it all - after eating some delicious warm bread as a starter, of course. I really can't say enough good things about Mia Francesca. I'll certainly be back to try a new dish!

Found the place by accident, looking for Italian while in Lakeview with a friend from out of town. Figured more memorable places might somewhere else but we stumbled on this through Googling and so glad we did. Discovered a long wait in the early evening (a good sign) but we took a seat at the bar and thoroughly enjoyed interacting with the attentive staff while we dined. I WILL be back. A good local place to know.

Found out Friday was National Pasta Day, seemed like a perfect reason to "carbo-load" to star the weekend! Made 8:30 pm reservations, arrived at 8:10 pm  and seated right away. Small space, very tightly packed with lots of people having a boisterous good time. Staff in general appeared a little overwhelmed. Our server was super pleasant and adorable, with just the right amount of sarcasm to match my mood. An absolute delight she was! Food was solid Italian fare as always. This evening featured a selection of $4 pastas in honor of the "holiday" of National Pasta Day, so those were pretty difficult to pass up. Started our meal with the Tomato & Blue Cheese salad and Fried Calamari. Both delicious. Pastas, one with rigatoni and eggplant and the other small shells with mozzarella, were cooked perfectly. For dessert, in keeping with the carbohydrate packed night, we finished off with banana chocolate bread pudding. A reasonably priced bottle of Sangiovese rounded out the meal. A delightful evening.

I have been dining at Mia Francesca for 10+ years and have usually enjoyed it. The last three times, however, service has been very poor. The kitchen churns out food so fast and it's slung at you like in a diner -- on every visit, I've had entrees show up before I'm even done with a starter -- in one case, less than 5 minutes after the starter had been put down. The timing and air of service is wildly off, and the kitchen exhaust no longer seems to work -- I've left each time reeking of grease and cooking smell. I would say avoid for now, or try Francesca's on Bryn Mawr, which seems to still be OK.

A little overpriced for cold pasta. My dish was personally the best out of everyone I was dining with (it was also a special and the most expensive). I thought the ambiance was very traditional, warm and personable. However, I have had better Italian worth more of the price, not that it was outrageous... Just not what I was expecting for $17.

Foods good, atmosphere is fine. But, BYOR!! What is "R" you ask yourself? Well it's ranch. Sorry don't care how "elegant" and "italian" of a place you are but damnit if you are serving me a pizza...I expect a dipping sauce that is everything ranch. It's 2014 and you suck for not having it. Period. Also if you are out of oregano or any other spices and just don't want to fork over the money, look no further!! Asking for a side of oregano guarantees you a cup full of your fav spice and a year or mores worth to cook with! And it comes with a cute baby spoon! Really what more can one ask for!

Service: I decided to dine at this restaurant on a whim, so unfortunately I didn't make a reservation, like most. Despite no reservation, I was seated under the estimated time (waited 45 mins ish, quoted an hour plus). The food came out rather quickly, too. Drinks served promptly. Service gets two thumbs up!!  Ambience: Casual environment, but ridiculously loud. Carrying on a simple conversation across the table seems almost impossible. For this reason, I do not recommend this restaurant for groups or intimate gatherings. Food: I have received numerous recommendations from the locals in the area to dine at this spot because of the authentic cuisine. To be honest..it's average. If you do not frequently cook delicious Italian food, like myself, perhaps it will appeal to you more than me. The ONLY dish I will rave about is their goat cheese appetizer - YUM!  Cost: Unless your getting a dish that has a hodgepodge of seafood, I would say this place is too expensive for average pasta bathed in mediocre sauces. Save your money, buy box pasta, and doctor up some jarred sauce.  Overall: Aforementioned, if you don't cook Italian food, I think this restaurant will [potentially] rock your socks.

We missed our reservation because of traffic so we had to dine late after a comedy show. This place was amazing and the waiter was very accommodating (It might have been cause it was so late and there were only a few tables filled but whatever). The food was excellent, we ordered the bruschetta and we both got the rosemary chicken. Everything was superb. The music they were playing didn't really fit the ambiance but we personally didn't care. All and all this place was great and I would totally go again.

Went here for Sunday brunch with my wife and daughter. Wow very bad!!!! It took 10 min. For a server to come by, with the place empty don't understand that. My daughter ordered warm tee and honey. After 15 min. The tea came out ice cold with no honey. I told the waiter the water for the tea was cold can you please bring it back with hot water and honey please. 10 more min later tea came back out still cold and no honey. I finally told the server to put the water in the microwave and hit high for 3 min. Needless to say kitchen did not know how to boil water. LOL!!! We ordered omelets nothing hard to cook for breakfast. Omelets were undercooked and greasy. Outside tables dirty and poor service to match will not be coming back.

After a six-year hiatus, returned to Mia Francesca for an anniversary dinner, wanting, hoping to like it. Sadly, no luck. This place combines bland, soulless "Corporate Italian" food with efficient but cold service. The pesto was completely tasteless (tip: at least add some GARLIC), and the chicken in the pasta tasted like it had been frozen (and the suspiciously identical strips suggested it was). With so many outstanding options for Italian on the north side, can't see coming back, again.  Under-flavored, over-priced, and way too pleased with itself.

Honestly, I found this place by mistake. I was planning on going to a different restaurant I found on Yelp, but ended up taking the wrong street and walked by Mia Francesca! First of all, their menu is awesome. They switch it up every now and then so you might have to get something different every time you go there! We started off with the bruschetta - the fancier one that is a dollar more than the original - totally worth the extra dollar. It came with arugula and avocado on top. It was one of the best bruschetta I've ever had.  For my entree, I ordered the special ravioli. I want to say I tasted some goat cheese in the ravioli, but I'm not sure. It was delicious though! Super filling, so I thought the price was just right. On Thursdays, they do $5 martinis. I ordered the Blood Orange martini. It was good at first, but granted, Svedka... not the best. For dessert, the special was a peanut butter cream pie with peanut butter whipped cream and an Oreo crust. I wish I were eating it now. Service is good. There are many servers around who can assist you. Also, definitely sit in the back patio! I love the mural!

Really really good!!! I had some kind of pasta with pot roast and the pot roast was great! Very tender. My boyfriend ordered something that wasn't even on the menu and they made it for him happily. The wait was long but it was a Saturday night and the food was excellent, as was the wine. Great date spot too!

The experience was very good and we would go back to this spot. But know that the food prepared their is not the Italian fare you would fine at some of Chicago's popular Italian restaurants. Our first visit resulted in delicious food and friendly service. We ordered the Pollo Arrostro all Romano, Cavetti con Pesto y Pollo, and the bow tie pasta with salmon. Everyone enjoyed their respective main course.  However the best dish that all enjoyed was the melted goat cheese with marinara sauce appetizer. Awesome! The fried calamari was fresh, light and crisp. Not greasy. The pear and blue cheese salad was uneventful. The poached pear was too, too sweet and the pear to greens ratio was off. Too little greens for the amount of pear. The blue cheese they use for the salad is delicious.   For me, its a well executed Americanized version of Italian food. For example; no eggplant or chicken parmesan, sausage and peppers, Bucatini all'Amatriciana, pasta Carbonara or seafood apps. Yet, want we ordered was well executed and enjoyed.

This little gem is within walking distance to our house. This was my first time and it far exceeded any expectations I had. Ordered the Risotto and Bruschetta for appetizer followed by the Ravioli and Pollo Arrosto Alla Romana. Everything was very fresh but the Pollo Arrosto was a home run!. My wife and I can't wait to go back.

I came here with a group for a bachelorette dinner. Our table wasn't completely ready when we arrived, but we didn't have to wait long The seating in this place is horrible. The tables are so close together, even the very skinny one in our group had a difficult time getting around the table to sit in back. But after she got back there, she had to move to a chair. The bench along the wall sits very high and nobody wanted to sit back there. The place is very loud because the kitchen is open to the restaurant and the staff was constantly clanking the china. There was also a server near the front who was cleaning the silverware. As he cleaned each one, he loudly dropped it into a tub.  They also had very loud background music, and everyone had to talk over all these other sounds. Our server had a very broken English and was having trouble understanding us as much as we had difficulty understanding him.   Service was slow - very slow. They had a full bar inside the very small restaurant.  I think they would be better off using the space instead for seating.  The had a nice selection of specialty drinks. Our food was good, but nothing to brag about.  Everyone had something a little different, so I won't pick out any specific food item. Again, service was slow, so it took a long time before the server came back to ask if we wanted dessert. A couple people ordered dessert, and said it was also good. Since our bride-to-be had a sash stating she was the bachelorette, it was nice of the restaurant to send a round of after dinner shots to the table, however only one or two of the people in my party liked the taste.

I don't even know where to begin with this total disaster other than to tell you in one sentence to skip this place don't even waste your time. Normally I'm a critic of cheesy Chicago Italian restaurants, this place tries to bust that stigma by having several local locations and a rotating seasonable menu.  Unfortunately the boring menu and horrendous execution lack in every possible way.  First, we were seated up stairs in the midst of a rehearsal party, loud, couldn't walk, annoying. Several tables were seated at once and our server was slow to come to us after going to a table next to us twice. His utter incompetence continued to show through the rest of the meal. We asked for more bread it arrived 10 minutes later. The table side olive oil is nice as it has a touch of heat from chilis. Appetizers of prosciutto and asparagus and calamari were ok, if not a touch too small. I enjoyed the marinara sauce. Once entrees came this mess went even further downhill.  1 of 7 diners didn't receive his food. When he did after complaining, it was  the wrong dish. Then we just said forget about it, then it came out anyway. What a waste of food. My skate wing was inedible. The spinach was so salty I thought I was at McDonald's. The fish looked like it was covered in puke and was also so salty a couple bites was all I could muster. No one at the restaurant asked why I inexplicably only had two bites.  Hilariously the service was such a joke they brought the wrong food to other tables 3 times, just seemed totally lost. Management at least tried but at that point who cares.  We got a free entrees and 4 free desserts. When I'm starving, free dessert doesn't cut it.  Dinning wear looked like plastic plates from a cafeteria. Very strange.  Horrendous experience I'll never be back.

Oh so good Italian food. Our large party shared bruschetta and calamari. Each was good, and while the breaded deep fried calamari rings have lost their luster at most restaurants, these were light but flavorful. My pasta and seafood dish was great -- it came as ordered (changes to the menu seem totally okay), the scallops were perfectly cooked (not raw but not chewy either) and the pasta had a great firm texture that was worth going back for. Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their dishes that ranged from the half roasted chicken (ordered by the regulars) and a couple of pizzas that looked phenomenal. I was too full to order dessert, but I'd go back just to try the tiramisu that someone ordered and promptly devoured. And they handled my 6yo very well. Hard to give 5 stars on the basis of one visit, but if they do this well on my next time around, they'll have that extra star for sure.
Best Italian restaurant in Chicago! Be sure to sit outside in the back! Feels like Italy!!!

Great pasta! This place was really great - the pasta was super tasty, but the buratta left something to be desired. Not amazing quality.  Its a little cramped inside and there are lots of families - wouldn't recommend for a date or a relaxing night out. Price point a touch higher than you'd expect given the scene.

I have been coming here for years and I have yet to be disappointed. This is one italian restaurant I love dining at, and it has stayed on my top 3 ever since I started!  The bread has always been warm and fresh and the food is always on point. A lot of their main menu items stick around - but there are quite a few entrees that switch their ways in and out with the seasons and popularity. There is always a specials menu that changes every night I believe. The cooking here is impeccable and I cannot stress enough that everything here is done really well.  I've never had a bad server experience either, which can be a rare feat for this near-Wrigley location. Everyone I have had has been helpful and excellent at suggestions, accommodations, and wine/drink pairings.  What sparked my review after all of this time was my reservation around 9pm (we arrived early) and had to leave by 9:30. Our waitress was attentive even though this place was packed (Saturday evening), and everything was brought out super fast, and we were done at 9:24.  I will say I am REALLY DISAPPOINTED that there is no more peanut butter chocolate tart dessert anymore. I guess they took it off a few months ago. I was seriously devastated - a girl has to have her dessert! I will be writing to hopefully encourage them to bring it back (or give me the recipe!)

The food is good, but the portions are a bit too big. Like, JUMBO size!  The service is excellent too and they make killer cocktails. It's also reasonably priced. The place was fully booked, but they let us in anyway since one of the tables just left. We were surrounded by noise but I just chose to ignore it and focus on my date. Still, it gets quite loud in there, so be forewarned.

Was here a couple of weeks ago visiting a friend in Chicago. She took me to this restaurant and it was absolutely delicious. A bit crowded, but who could blame them with the incredible food they're dishing up. The service was fantastic, too! Absolutely loved every dish I tried. Will definitely be going back there again next time I am in Chicago.

can't believe I've never reviewed this place before.  Have been here about 5 times over the years and never dissapointed.  the only drawback I have always had is the noise level.  If you are sitting at a two top you are kind of on top of the people next to you and hear everyone's conversations.   I have never had a bad glass of wine, bad appetizer, bad entree or bad service.  I do agree to avoid the restaurant on game day nights but it is just far south enough to get away from the foot traffic of wrigley.  Will always go back and was just there two weeks ago.

OMG! Restaurant Week 2014 dream come true...4 courses that provides ample food choices. The 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th course meal was extremely DELISH. 1st course was an awesome salad, 2nd course was the seafood pasta, 3rd course was a chicken option that included rosemary with white wine. Yummy! The service was great. The delivery of the meals were right on time. The host was pleasant and the waiter was extremely handsome...(which made the food taste better). The Overall experience was great!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on a Sunday night, it was our first time and we were not disappointed!  There are a lot of Italian restaurants in Lakeview, and I would say Mia Francesca is up to par with the others I've visited. Like most Italian restaurants in the area- Mia Francesca is small, moderately lit, and has some traditional and creative offerings on the menu.  Yes you will be sitting nearby another diner, and you will probably hear some of their conversation, if that's not what you're in the mood for then hike on over to Olive Garden, because this is Chicago and space is limited. Olive oil has flakes of basil marinating inside, it pairs nicely with their warm bread and parmesan.  We shared the Bocconcini de Mozzarella which was delish!  The mozzarella was so fresh and the peppers added a nice taste, it was very light and clean.  I had their Valentine's Day special with seabass and vegetables, it was a perfect piece of fish and the vegetables were crunchy and perfectly sauced.  The seabass was lightly fried on the outside, so those bites were a bit oily which I didn't prefer.  My boyfriend had the filet with mushrooms and spinach, we had to send it back because it was a little undercooked, but once they got the temperature correct it was so good! Our server Meredith was so sweet, she checked in on us appropriately and made fantastic wine pairing recommendations.  She was honest with our inquiries about food taste and popularity, I am pleased she steered me in a good direction for my meal. We would go back, Mia Francesca will go into our rotation of Italian dinner spots for sure!

This is such a great place. The service was absolutely excellent.  The salad was the freshest and had a great flavor.  The dinner was excellent. The deserts were homemade great. The wine was perfect. My words for this place would be great food.

I have to say how disappointed I am in this restaurant. I've tried other Francesca's before in the burbs and they were all great but I sat at the table for a half hour waiting for someone to wait on me. When he did, I asked what the soup of the day, he couldn't tell me and left for another 5 minutes. Then I proceeded to sit at my seat and watched all the staff members hang out for a while. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but the service will make it so I never go back

I came here for Restaurant Week, and overall I was underwhelmed by not only the selection (or lack there of), but by also what was served when I ordered off the special menu. I don't remember the specific name, but it was something osso buco (veal). Basically, it was ground veal wrapped in pasta. Not only was the portion small for the price ($16.99) (especially in comparison to their normal dishes), it was also chewy and didn't have much taste. We ordered Malbec wine; I thought it was whatever. My friend ordered the chicken alla salvia, which looked much bigger and better than my meal and was only a dollar more! I think if I were ever to come back, I'd want to try their regular menu, but not worth it for Restaurant Week in my opinion.

I held a surprise party for my partner's 50th birthday for 21 guests in January 2014. It was upstairs. The party planner Katherine was great, filled with helpful suggestions. The servers were very attentive, and stayed late. The food was excellent. This location was an old favorite we hadn't been to in many years, and it still is a great restaurant. I heartily recommend it.

The food was excellent! The biggest gripe I had with this restaurant, which is admittedly small, is that their menu is relatively limited. All of my friends loved their food, and they have valet parking for $10 dollars!
This place is awesome. I ordered seafood pasta and I was so happy with my meal. It made me full for 2 days.. Def order more..
